properties.areaDesc: Bibb, AL; Jefferson, AL; Shelby, AL
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 10 at 2:14PM CST until February 10 at 6:30PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
At 207 PM CST, Flash Flooding was ongoing across Jefferson and
Shelby Counties. Numerous roadways have become impassible due to
flooding. Numerous reports of flooding from Emergency Management and
the public on social media continue to increase.

A considerable flash flood threat is expected to materialize over
the next few hours across southern Jefferson, northern Bibb, and all
of Shelby County. Those locations will also include areas along and
south of the I-459 corridor. DO NOT DRIVE ACROSS FLOODED ROADWAYS.
Up to three inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is
already occurring.

HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash
flooding.

SOURCE...Public.

IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams,
urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Alabaster, Bessemer, Homewood,
Pelham, Mountain Brook, Trussville, Helena, Hueytown, Gardendale,
Irondale, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Fairfield, Chelsea, Fultondale and
Montevallo.

Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the
warned area through 630pm.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring.
If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately.
Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate
precautions to protect life and property.

NWSheadline: THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CST FOR SHELBY...CENTRAL BIBB AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES
